The bureau is proposing a five-tier fee structure based on the vehicleâs rated power, and the adjustment will be implemented in phases over three years.

The proposals will be discussed at the Legislative Councilâs transport panel on April 25.

Title: Support measures urged for SMEs amid trade war
Summary:
Legislators from the Business and Professionals Alliance (BPA) on Wednesday urged the government to roll out support measures for Hong Kong's business sector amid the ongoing trade war.

The lawmakers said authorities should help companies obtain financing from banks and keep up with their cashflow, such as by allowing small and medium enterprises (SMEs) to defer loan repayments.

Jeffrey Lam said the sector is having a hard time.

"Some people are thinking of moving their production facilities out of Hong Kong into Asean countries," he said. 

"But it's not easy. They need to find land or a factory space, then equip it with their machines, train people.

"It will take months... So what's everybody going to do during this time when the factory is setting up, paying a high price for merchandise? It is not fair to the people."

Lam said SMEs are the "lifeline" of Hong Kong's economy and important driving forces of economic growth in the SAR.

The lawmakers said the government should also work harder to attract foreign companies to Hong Kong, which includes setting up a fund to provide grants to leading enterprises.

Title: Govt urged to beef up penalties for animal cruelty
Summary:
Animal welfare groups on Wednesday urged the government to beef up penalties for animal cruelty and make Hong Kong a more pet-friendly city. 

At a press conference at the Legislative Council, the organisations said the current penalty of HK$200,000 and a jail term of three years is not enough. 

They want to increase the fine to HK$1 million and extend jail terms to seven years for a stronger deterrent effect. 

Susan Lai, founder of the Animal Rights and Welfare Association, said there are loopholes with the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Ordinance.

âThere is an urgent need to review the current legislation, including the addition of 'due diligence' in the legislation, and also increase the penalty regarding any animal cruelty case,â she said.

âCurrently it is very difficult to provide evidence, and successful prosecution cases are actually very low.â

Despite there being nearly 500 animal cruelty cases reported in the first nine months of 2024, the prosecution rate was only three percent, official figures showed.

North District councillor Corey Lau said authorities should also review restrictions for pets in restaurants and expand their access to public transport. 

âThe demand is very high in Hong Kong because many pet owners want to transport and eat with their pets in the restaurants. That's why there's a demand for the improvement of the law,â he said.

DAB lawmaker Edward Lau will meet officials from the Environment and Ecology Bureau to discuss these proposals later this month.

Title: 'HK people should unite and promote national security'
Summary:
Federation of Trade Unions lawmaker Bill Tang said all sectors of Hong Kong society should unite and pay attention to the importance of national security, one of the three messages that he said top Beijing official Xia Baolong told Hong Kong in his keynote speech marking the National Security Education Day on Tuesday.

Speaking to RTHK, Tang said people in Hong Kong, especially entrepreneurs, should prioritise national security over development, and they simply could not just focus on development and overlook national security.

The FTU lawmaker said the speech by the director of the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office also emphasised the importance of remembering past events and remaining vigilant in times of peace.

Tang also said Xia called for a clear recognition of the current situation and an understanding of the pressure facing China and the SAR.

The lawmaker pointed out that it is essential to strengthen national education for the younger generation.

Title: Electronic ticketing system set for driving offences
Summary:
Secretary for Transport and Logistics Mable Chan said on Wednesday that an electronic regime of fixed-penalty tickets is expected to be implemented on June 15 in an attempt to increase the overall efficiency of traffic enforcement.

She also said a new thematic portal and mobile application for electronic traffic enforcement will be introduced, enabling vehicle owners and drivers to verify and view tickets online and make payments for penalties via electronic means.

"The aim of digitalisation of traffic fixed penalty tickets is, in line with the direction of developing Hong Kong into a smart city, to increase the overall efficiency of traffic enforcement through the application of technology, improving the accuracy and speeding up the turnaround in the process of inputting, recording and retrieving information in relation to traffic offences or contraventions committed by offenders," she wrote in a written reply to the Legislative Council.

She said the full implementation of the measure is estimated to save around HK$12.4 million a year as well as about HK$232 million notional savings in manpower through redeployment of staff to other traffic management duties.

Title: Ombudsman urges construction checks be stepped up
Summary:
Ombudsman Jack Chan said on Wednesday the government should step up inspections to ensure the construction sector carries out safety checks thoroughly.

The call came after the Office of the Ombudsman completed a direct investigation operation into the enforcement of government regulations on occupational safety in the construction sector.

It made 40 recommendations to the Labour Department, the Buildings Department and the Development Bureau. 

Chan said some examiners had not carried out any inspections before certifying the safety of equipment, such as lifting appliances and bamboo scaffolds.

He said the government should formulate an inspection checklist and set up an electronic platform for the sector to upload inspection records to facilitate monitoring. 

âWe recommend the Labour Department require these examiners or certified persons to fill in a checklistâ¦ when they're checking the safety of these operations or appliances,â he said.

âWe propose to have a platform for these examiners to [upload] the examination records so that [they] could be easily checked by the Labour Department, and also make sure that they cannot fill in the form in advance because it's a real-time electronic platform.â

Chan said authorities should review the operational guidelines to select high-risk construction sites more precisely for in-depth surprise inspections. 

He also urged the Buildings Department to set up a mechanism to ensure timely follow-ups on cases referred to it by the Labour Department involving contractors who had been convicted of occupational safety and health offences.

Title: Frustration up over postal stop to US-bound parcels
Summary:
Some locals have been left frustrated by Hongkong Post's announcement on Wednesday that it has suspended surface parcel deliveries to the United States with immediate effect.

The move is made due to the longer shipping time required to deliver small parcels sent by surface mail in time to avoid the US tariffs that are coming into effect from May 2, given that Hongkong Post "will definitely not collect any so-called tariffs on behalf of the US".

Air delivery services will also be suspended starting from April 27.

However, postal items that only contain documents are not affected.

Freda Cheung, who runs an online business that often requires her to send airmail parcels to the United States, said the move will greatly affect her.

"I don't think I will use other courier services because the tax is too high for me," she told RTHK.

"So I will reject all US-bound packages."

Cheung said she will adopt a wait-and-see approach for now, adding that she might consider marketing for other countries like the ones in Europe.

Another resident, Chan, said he felt powerless, even though he only occasionally sends parcels to a friend in the United States.

"With the US imposing tariffs, there's nothing we can do as Hong Kong has to abide by it too," he said. 

"There's nothing we can change.

"I'll still pay the tariffs. There's no other way."

A man, Yeung, who sometimes sends parcel to his US relatives, said he will consider using international shipping companies.

However, he will only do so when there is an urgent need as he will have to pay more.

Title: Errant drivers to be brought to book in pilot scheme
Summary:
Police announced on Wednesday a new pilot programme to monitor traffic violations at four locations using security cameras starting on Tuesday, with the aim of enhancing road safety and enforcement efficiency.

The initiative will leverage the Transport Departmentâs existing traffic control and surveillance system, including CCTV systems, to detect unsafe driving.

Fixed penalty notices will be issued to offenders once drivers are identified through captured licence plate details and timestamps of violations.

The superintendent of traffic management at the traffic branch headquarters, Nip Hoi-kwan, said the programme expands enforcement capabilities.

"In the past, the Transport Department's traffic control and surveillance system did not have video recording capabilities," Nip said. 

"The purpose of this plan is simply to provide officers with an additional enforcement option.

"Based on traffic conditions or their experience, officers will assess when congestion is likely to be more serious, and during those times, personnel will be sent to the control centre to monitor the traffic situation and activate the recording function."

The first phase targets Queenâs Road Central's intersections with Ice House Street, Pedder Street and Bonham Strand as well as the Queen's Road East intersection with Wong Nai Chung Road.

The superintendent of the enforcement and control division of traffic Hong Kong Island, Mak Chung-kit, said these sites were chosen due to recurring violations and their disproportionate impact on broader traffic flow.

"In the past, we have continuously deployed our officers, whether for patrolling, law enforcement or directing traffic, and have invested a significant amount of manpower and resources," Mak said.

"However, traffic violations and congestion at the affected locations often reoccur shortly after our officers leave. 

"We found that the effectiveness of our officers' presence is very short-lived.

"At these four locations, traffic violations such as illegal parking, illegal pick-ups and drop-offs or yellow box junction obstructions can cause congestion that, even in a very short period of time, will impact nearby major roads and even affect trunk roads."

The police said the aim is to bolster public compliance with traffic laws, reduce accident risks and alleviate congestion through sustained monitoring.

The three-month pilot will undergo a review before potential expansion, with outcomes informing future enforcement strategies.

Title: HK eyes e-commerce, silver economy amid challenges
Summary:
Hong Kong needs to seek new growth opportunities amid global uncertainties, such as developing e-commerce and the silver economy, says Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development Algernon Yau. 

Speaking on RTHK's Overview Policy programme on Wednesday, Yau said geopolitical challenges and supply-chain disruptions are affecting the city's economy.

"Under these circumstances, Hong Kong must seek new ways forward," he said. 

"There are many good examples, such as the chief executive leading multiple visits to the Middle East and Asean countries."

While the SAR has traditionally relied on trade with Europe and the United States, there is a need to seek new economic partnerships to mitigate geopolitical influences, Yau said. 

Noting the mainland's impressive e-commerce transaction volumes last year, he said online shopping is one key area that Hong Kong can tap into. 

Yau said a shopping festival held in August attracted a good response from the mainland, with 230 brands participating and more than 90 million impressions on discussion forums and the official website. 

The minister also highlighted the importance of developing a silver economy, noting that around one-third of Hong Kong's population â or 2.67 million people â will be over 65 years old by 2043. 

"While we need to address welfare issues for elderly people from grassroots groups, there are also many middle-class or better-off seniors who own properties and have pension funds," he said. 

"How can we stimulate consumption among this demographic? 

"Despite their substantial economic power, society seems to pay little attention to their spending needs," Yau said.

A government working group on the silver economy is focused on five areas: boosting consumption, developing the industry, promoting quality assurance, enhancing financial security and unleashing productivity.

Title: HK junior fencing team wins bronze in Wuxi
Summary:
Hong Kong, China's junior menâs epee team made history at the World Cadets and Juniors Fencing Championships in Wuxi, clinching their first-ever bronze medal in the event - a landmark achievement for the SAR. 

The quartet of Gao Ying-chuen, Kenton Hsu, Wong Chi-ho, and Yuen Nok-man stormed through the early rounds, overcoming the Netherlands, Germany and Ukraine in succession to secure a spot in the semifinals. 

Although they were stopped by Canada in their quest for gold, the team regrouped for a dramatic bronze-medal showdown against Hungary.

In a tense finale, Hong Kong narrowly edged out their rivals 45-43. 

Trailing 23-25 at halftime, Yuen turned the tide with a gritty 3-1 rally in the sixth round to level the score at 26-26. 

Wong then ignited a commanding 9-3 surge, propelling Hong Kong to a 35-29 lead and cementing their path to victory.

Italy claimed gold in the event, with Canada securing silver. 

The menâs team bronze, combined with Wu Haidiâs earlier third-place finish in the womenâs cadet individual epee, capped Hong Kongâs campaign with two medals - a record haul for the SAR at the championships.

Title: HK to suspend parcel postal services to the US
Summary:
Hongkong Post announced on Wednesday an immediate suspension of parcel services to the United States via surface mail, due to the longer shipping time as small parcels are due to be hit by US tariffs from May 2.

It said it would contact the senders of such mail to make return and refund arrangements from April 22 if their parcels had not yet been shipped to the US.

For air parcels, services will stop from April 27.

"The US is unreasonable, bullying and imposing tariffs abusively. Hongkong Post will definitely not collect any so-called tariffs on behalf of the US and will suspend the acceptance of postal items containing goods destined to the US," a statement said.

Other postal items containing documents only without goods will not be affected.

Title: GBA is a big draw for tourists: CE
Summary:
Chief Executive John Lee said the Greater Bay Area (GBA) offers a key development opportunity for local tourism. 

Lee made the comments in a speech at the 2025 World Tourism Cities Federation Hong Kong Fragrant Hills Tourism Summit held in the SAR on Tuesday.

The CE pointed out that the GBA has a population of over 86 million and a combined GDP rivalling that of the world's 10th largest economy.

"What it means is a consumer market and source of tourists that is over 10 times as large as our own city. What it also means, with our countryâs facilitation measures for travellers, is that visitors who choose to visit this part of the world have much more cities to add to their itinerary," Lee said.

"We are fast developing in multi-destination tourism for an interconnected world."

Lee also said the SAR is dedicated to free and open trade, despite global trade tensions.

Title: HK 'is a pivotal region for I&T development'
Summary:
An association representing global mobile operators said on Tuesday Hong Kong is a pivotal region for the development of innovation and technology and that it can learn from the mainland. 

The Groupe Speciale Mobile Association (GSMA) said operators on the mainland and in Hong Kong are leaders in the development and implementation of artificial intelligence solutions. 

Speaking after the Asia-Pacific Summit of the World Internet Conference, association chief executive and director John Hoffman said Hong Kong should make use of its development centres and talent to further promote AI development.

"[The companies] are leading in many aspects of not only the development of AI through companies like DeepSeek and others that are pushing the boundaries of AI, but then to turn around and implement them in a way that it benefits society," he said.

"It's not technology for technology's sake, but it's technology for the betterment of industry, businesses, government and of course society."

Hoffman said the mainland has some of the largest mobile operators in the world and Hong Kong should make use of its proximity to the mainland to learn from the firms.

"I think Hong Kong has proven in the past that it's a place of export," he said. 

"It's a place where others can learn from... Hong Kong must seize that opportunity to learn from the mainland, then adapt and modify to its local conditions.

"Hopefully the rest of the world can look to Hong Kong and say 'This is a great solution. Let me try something similar'."

The Digital Policy Office on Tuesday released guidelines on the application of generative AI, aiming to facilitate the safe and responsible use of AI by the industry and the public.

Hoffman said guidelines on the use of AI must be localised but stressed that they should be established under a framework that allows innovation to further develop.

Title: Macron announces joint Franco-Haiti commission to examine shared past
Summary: PARIS (Reuters) -     French President Emmanuel Macron said he intends to set up a joint Franco-Haitian commission to examine France's shared past with its former Caribbean colony, which won its independence 200 years ago on April 17, 1825. Read full story

Title: Trump challenges judges' probes of compliance with deportation orders
Summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -     The Trump administration is appealing efforts by two judges to investigate whether government officials defied their rulings over the deportation of migrants to El Salvador, escalating a confrontation between the executive and judicial branches Read full story

Title: MACC Economy Ministry form special team to monitor state, district projects
Summary: PUTRAJAYA: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) and the Economy Ministry have jointly formed a special team to monitor projects approved by the ministry at the state and district levels. Read full story

Title: Russia removes Afghan Taliban from list of banned terrorist groups
Summary: MOSCOW (Reuters) -     Russia on Thursday suspended its ban on the Taliban, which it had designated for more than two decades as a terrorist organisation, in a move that paves the way for Moscow to normalise ties with the leadership of Afghanistan. Read full story

Title: High Court rules it has jurisdiction to hear lawsuit against Raghad
Summary: KUCHING: The High Court here on Thursday (April 17) ruled that it has jurisdiction to hear the lawsuit filed by the sons of the late Tun Abdul Taib Mahmud, Sarawak's seventh Governor, against their stepmother, Toh Puan Raghad Kurdi Taib. Read full story

Title: Jalur Gemilang gaffe: Sin Chew Daily editors detained, to be released tonight, says IGP
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The Chief Editor and Deputy Chief Sub-editor of the Sin Chew Daily newspaper, who were summoned to Bukit Aman on Thursday (April 17) to assist in investigations regarding the publication of an incomplete illustration of the Jalur Gemilang on the newspaper's front page, have been detained. Read full story

Title: Mission to set up field hospital in Myanmar put on hold
Summary: TAPAH: The mission to deploy medical officers to Myanmar to set up a field hospital, which was scheduled to depart yesterday, has been postponed at the request of Myanmar's authorities, says Foreign Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan. Read full story

Title: Cops discover ketum processing facility during raid in Penang, two nabbed
Summary: BALIK PULAU: A double-storey terrace house on Jalan Kelicap here was discovered to be a processing facility for ketum juice during a police raid on Thursday (April 17). Read full story

Title: Local man denies insulting the King online
Summary: JOHOR BARU: A local man has denied making a social media post insulting His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, which has gone viral. Read full story

Title: China ready to share rare earth processing technology with Malaysia
Summary: TAPAH: China is poised to share its rare earth processing technology with Malaysia, a move that could substantially enhance the commodity's value in the global market. Read full story

Title: UN nuclear chief says Iran, US running out of time to secure deal
Summary: TEHRAN : UN nuclear watchdog chief Rafael Grossi said Thursday that Iran and the United States were running out of time to secure a deal as they prepare to hold fresh nuclear talks this weekend. Iranian and US delegations are to gather in Rome on Saturday for a second round of Omani-mediated negotiations, a week after the longtime foes held their highest-level talks since US President Donald Trump abandoned a landmark nuclear accord in 2018. âWe are in a very crucial stage of these important negotiations. We know we donât have much time, this is why I am here ... to facilitate this process,â Grossi said on a visit to Tehran. âWe are working hard and we want to succeed,â he told a joint news conference with Iranâs atomic energy agency chief Mohammad Eslami, acknowledging that the search for a deal was ânot an easy processâ. On Wednesday, Grossi met with Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi, who led the first round of talks with US Special Envoy Steve Witkoff on Saturday. Araghchi said he had a âusefulâ meeting with the International Atomic Energy Agency chief. âThe IAEA can play a crucial role in peaceful settlement of the Iranian nuclear file in the coming months,â he said. Araghchi called on the IAEA chief to âkeep the agency away from politicsâ in the face of âspoilersâ seeking to âderail current negotiationsâ. He did not elaborate. âNot farâ from possessing bomb Before heading to Iran, Grossi told French newspaper Le Monde that Tehran was ânot farâ from possessing a nuclear bomb. Western governments have long accused Iran of seeking to acquire a nuclear weapons capability, an ambition Tehran has consistently denied. A year after Trump pulled out of the 2015 nuclear deal, Iran began rolling back its own commitments under the agreement, which gave it relief from sanctions in return for IAEA-monitored restrictions on its nuclear activities. In its latest report, the IAEA said Iran had an estimated 274.8 kilogrammes (605 pounds) of uranium enriched to up to 60 percent. That level far exceeds the 3.67 percent enrichment ceiling set by the 2015 deal, but still falls short of the 90 percent threshold required for a nuclear warhead. Since he returned to office in January, Trump has revived his âmaximum pressureâ policy of punishing economic sanctions against Iran. In March, he sent a letter to Iranâs supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei urging talks and warning of possible military action if Iran refused. On Thursday, the New York Times reported that Trump had blocked an Israeli plan to strike Iranian nuclear facilities in favour of seeking a negotiated deal. âConflicting positionsâ On Tuesday, Khamenei cautioned that while the talks with the United States had started well, they could yet prove fruitless. âThe negotiations may or may not yield results,â he said. On Wednesday, Araghchi said Iranâs enrichment of uranium was not up for discussion after Witkoff called for a halt. Witkoff had previously demanded only that Iran return to the 3.67 percent enrichment ceiling set by the 2015 deal. Araghchi said he hoped to start negotiations on the framework of a possible agreement, but that this required âconstructive positionsâ from the United States. âIf we continue to (hear) contradictory and conflicting positions, we are going to have problems,â he warned. On Thursday, Iranâs top diplomat was in Moscow on a âpre-plannedâ visit to the Tehran ally. Kremlin aide Yuri Ushakov said Araghchi would meet Russian President Vladimir Putin later in the day. âOur regular exchanges with Russia and China have allowed us to align our positions,â Araghchi said on his arrival in the Russian capital. Meanwhile, the official Saudi Press Agency reported that Defence Minister Prince Khaled bin Salman had travelled to Tehran for talks on Thursday. During his first term, Trump attempted to forge an alliance between Israel and the Gulf Arab states against Iran. But in 2023 Tehran and Riyadh restored ties in a Chinese-brokered rapprochement, while the outbreak of the Gaza war later the same year soured relations between all Arab states and Israel.

Title: China ready to share rare earth processing technology with Malaysia
Summary: TAPAH : China is ready to share its rare earth processing technology with Malaysia - a move that could substantially boost the commodityâs value in the global market. Foreign Minister Datuk Seri Mohamad Hasan said that rare earth processing not only boosts national revenue but also benefits state governments, as mineral resources fall under their jurisdiction. âPresident Xi Jinping himself stated during yesterdayâs meeting between Malaysia and China that they are willing to share the technology. âRare earth is a gift from Allah SWT to Malaysia. If we sell it raw and unprocessed, the value is relatively low, but once processed, its value increases significantly â by as much as 10 to 15 times,â the Barisan Nasional (BN) deputy chairman told reporters at the Batu Tiga polling district centre here today. Xiâs three-day state visit to Malaysia, which began on Tuesday, was at the invitation of His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia. The visit is Xiâs second official visit to Malaysia in 12 years, after the first in 2013, which saw the two countries upgrade diplomatic relations to a Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.

Title: Anwar, Paetongtarn reaffirm ASEANâs collective stand on US tariffs
Summary: BANGKOK : Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and his Thai counterpart, Paetongtarn Shinawatra have reaffirmed their commitment to addressing the issue of United States (US) tariffs collectively at the ASEAN level. Anwar, currently on a two-day working visit to Thailand, said delegations from both Malaysia and Thailand discussed the matter during their bilateral meeting. âWe also deliberated on the issue of US tariffs and reaffirmed our commitment to addressing it collectively at the ASEAN level through a fair and sustainable negotiation framework,â he said during the bilateral meeting with Paetongtarn at Government House here today. Anwar expressed his appreciation to the Thai prime minister for her commitment to strengthening bilateral ties. âI value the Thai governmentâs willingness to continue advancing existing agreements, particularly those aimed at enhancing the economies of northern Malaysia and southern Thailand. âWith Thailand now Malaysiaâs sixth-largest trading partner, and total trade exceeding US$25 billion last year, these initiatives will help us achieve our US$30 billion target by 2027,â he said. Earlier, Anwar and Paetongtarn witnessed the signing of a memorandum of understanding (MoU) concerning the construction agreement (CA) for the Rantau Panjang-Sungai Golok Bridge Project. Meanwhile in a press conference, Paetongtarn said three main topics were discussed with Anwar: the Sungai Golok Bridge project, peace in Thailandâs southern provinces, and US tariffs. Regarding the Sungai Golok Bridge, she said construction is ongoing and is expected to be completed on schedule. âAs for peace in southern Thailand, we sought Malaysiaâs cooperation, with a primary focus on economic development. This includes initiatives such as halal food production and the Rubber City project. âWe agreed on transforming the âbattlefieldâ into a âtrade fieldâ to promote cooperation and mutual economic benefits,â she said. Paetongtarn also noted that both leaders discussed how ASEAN member states could respond collectively to US tariffs. âASEAN has a large population and significant potential if we act in unison. We also explored the different strategies that each country is adopting and agreed that every nation would proceed with its respective approach,â she said.

Title: Malaysia, China deepen ties with new giant panda conversation deal
Summary: PUTRAJAYA : The signing of a new agreement for the International Cooperation Project on Giant Panda Conservation will enable Malaysia to receive a new pair of Giant Pandas for the next 10 years. Natural Resources and Environmental Sustainability Minister Nik Nazmi Nik Ahmad said the joint endeavor symbolises the collaborative project between China and Malaysia, and promotes conservation diplomacy, consistent with Malaysia MADANIâs values of global collaboration in sustainability initiatives. âI hope that the giant pandas, who are special envoys from China, can further promote understanding and close cooperation between the two countries. âMalaysia will continue to be committed to working with China for the conservation and enhancement of scientific cooperation in the preservation of the iconic wildlife species, the giant panda,â he said in a statement today. Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and Chinaâs President Xi Jinping on Wednesday witnessed the exchange of 31 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) and documents covering various sectors of cooperation between the two countries. Among them was the new agreement for the International Cooperation Project on Giant Panda Conservation, which was signed by the Director-General of the Department of Wildlife and National Parks (PERHILITAN) of Peninsular Malaysia Datuk Abdul Kadir Abu Hashim and the Secretary-General of China Wildlife Conservation Association (CWCA) Yan Jian. Malaysia, through a previous agreement signed on June 15, 2012, was granted a conservation cooperation project with a pair of giant pandas for 10 years, housed at the Giant Panda Conservation Centre, Zoo Negara. During this period, Malaysia has shown extraordinary achievements in the ex-situ conservation of giant pandas with the breeding and birth of three giant panda cubs. All three giant panda cubs have been returned to China in compliance with the terms of the agreement. Nuan Nuan, who was born on Aug 8, 2015, Yi Yi (Jan 14, 2018) and Sheng Yi on May 30, 2021 are the cubs of the giant panda couple Fu Wa and Feng Yi who were renamed Xing Xing and Liang Liang. Nuan Nuan was sent back to China in 2017, while Yi Yi and Sheng Yi left Malaysia on Aug 29, 2023. The panda parents were loaned to the Malaysian government in 2014 for 10 years, in conjunction with the 40th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Malaysia and China.

Title: 37 held in immigration raid on food court in Penang
Summary: GEORGE TOWN : The Immigration Department (JIM) of Penang detained 37 foreign nationals in a raid on a food court on Jalan Burma here today. Penang JIM director Nur Zulfa Ibrahim said the raid, conducted under the Northern Zone JIM Integrated Ops, was carried out as the food court is suspected to have employed the foreigners, comprising nationals from Myanmar (31 men and women); Bangladesh (two men); Vietnam (two men); Pakistan (one man); and Indonesia (one woman). âThe operation involved JIM personnel from Penang, Kedah and Perak and all those detained are aged between 21 and 48,â she said. Nur Zulfa said they were all detained on suspicion of having committed offences under the Immigration Act 1959/63 and the Immigration Regulations 1963, adding that action was also taken against those who employed the foreigners.

Title: Gaza rescuers say 40 mostly displaced people killed in Israeli strikes
Summary: GAZA CITY : Gazaâs civil defence agency said Thursday that a rash of Israeli air strikes killed at least 40 people, most of them in encampments for displaced civilians, as Israel pressed its offensive in the Palestinian territory. The Israeli military said it was looking into reports of the strikes, which came as Hamas officials reported that internal deliberations on the latest Israeli truce offer were nearly complete. Civil defence spokesman Mahmud Bassal said two Israeli missiles hit several tents in the Al-Mawasi area of the southern city of Khan Yunis, resulting in at least 16 deaths, âmost of them women and children, and 23 others were woundedâ. After Israel declared Al-Mawasi a safe zone in December 2023, tens of thousands of Palestinians flocked there seeking refuge from bombardment, but the area has since been hit by repeated Israeli strikes. Survivors described a large explosion at the densely packed encampment that set multiple tents ablaze. âWe were sitting peacefully in the tent, under Godâs protection, when we suddenly saw something red glowing -- and then the tent exploded, and the surrounding tents caught fire,â Israa Abu al-Rus told AFP. âThis is supposed to be a safe area in Al-Mawasi,â Abu al-Rus said. âWe fled the tent towards the sea and saw the tents burning.â Bassal said that Israeli strikes on two other encampments of displaced Gazans killed a further nine people -- seven in the northern town of Beit Lahia, and a father and son near Al-Mawasi. Separately, the civil defence reported two more attacks on displaced people in Jabalia -- one that killed at least seven members of the Asaliya family, and another that killed six people at a school being used as a shelter -- as well as Israeli shelling in Gaza City that killed two. The military later announced it had carried out a strike in Jabalia on what it said was a Hamas âcommand and controlâ centre. âStarvation as a weaponâ Israel said Wednesday that it had converted 30 percent of Gaza into a buffer zone in the widening offensive it resumed in March, ending a two-month ceasefire. Defence Minister Israel Katz said this month that the military was leaving Gaza âsmaller and more isolatedâ. The United Nations said half a million Palestinians have been displaced since the offensive resumed, triggering what it has described as the most severe humanitarian crisis since the war began with Hamasâs October 7, 2023 attack on Israel. The Israeli military said its air strikes had hit âapproximately 1,200 terror targetsâ since March 18. The leader of Qatar, which along with Egypt and the US helped mediate the January ceasefire deal, blamed Israel on Thursday for its collapse. âAs you know, we reached an agreement months ago, but unfortunately Israel did not abide by this agreement,â said Emir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al-Thani during a visit to Moscow. Qatar would continue to âstrive to bridge perspectives in order to reach an agreement that ends the suffering of the Palestinian peopleâ, he added. Acknowledging Qatarâs efforts, Russian President Vladimir Putin called the war in Gaza âa tragedyâ, saying a long-term resolution was âconnected to the establishment of two statesâ, Palestinian and Israeli. New truce offer Hamas accused Israel on Thursday of attempting to starve Gazaâs 2.4 million people after Katz said the day before that Israel would continue preventing aid from entering the territory. âThis is a public admission of committing a war crime, including the use of starvation as a weapon and the denial of basic necessities such as food, medicine, water, and fuel to innocent civilians for the seventh consecutive week,â the group said in a statement. During an impasse over the future of the ceasefire, Israel halted the entry of aid on March 2, exacerbating the territoryâs ongoing humanitarian crisis. In parallel to the Gaza offensive, Hamas said Israel had proposed a new 45-day ceasefire through mediators that would include the release of dozens of hostages. The proposal also called for Hamas to disarm to secure a complete end to the war, a demand the group rejects. Two Hamas officials said Thursday that internal discussions on the truce proposal were nearly complete, with one telling AFP âthe group will send its response to the mediators once they finishâ -- possibly on Thursday. Israelâs renewed assault has so far killed at least 1,691 people in Gaza, the health ministry in the Hamas-run territory reported, bringing the overall toll since the war erupted to 51,065, most of them civilians. Hamasâs October 2023 attack on Israel resulted in the deaths of 1,218 people, also mostly civilians, according to an AFP tally based on official Israeli figures.

Title: Jalur Gemilang gaffe: Police wrap up questioning of Sin Chew editors
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR : Police have completed recording statements from the Chief Editor and Deputy Chief Sub-editor of the Sin Chew Daily newspaper today to assist in investigations into the publication of an incomplete illustration of the Jalur Gemilang on the newspaperâs front page. Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Razarudin Husain said the process took about three hours at the Classified Crime Investigation Unit office at the Royal Malaysia Police (PDRM) headquarters in Bukit Aman. âThe entire process was completed at 3.45 pm,â he said when contacted today. The Chief Editor was said to have approved the publication of the illustration, while the Deputy Chief Sub-editor was responsible for designing the graphic. Razarudin said so far police have received 40 reports nationwide regarding the issue. The case is being investigated under Section 3(1)(c) of the Emblems and Names (Prevention of Improper Use) Act 1963 and Section 4(1)(b) of the Printing Presses and Publications Act 1984. On Tuesday, the Chinese-language daily published an illustration of the Jalur Gemilang on its front page in conjunction with coverage of Chinese President Xi Jinpingâs state visit to Malaysia, but the flag appeared incomplete. The incident drew criticism from various parties, including His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, who said the newspaperâs management and editorial department must be more careful and thoroughly vet materials before publication. Following the backlash, the newspaper issued an apology, stating that the mistake was a technical error and unintentional.

Title: Report on Sarawak wanting to buy AmBank stake mere speculation - Abang Johari
Summary: KUCHING : Sarawak Premier Tan Sri Abang Johari Tun Openg has described the report that the state wanted to acquire a stake in AMMB Holdings Bhd (AmBank Group) to merge with Affin Bank Bhd as mere speculation. He also denied that Sarawak had sent a state government representative to discuss the matter with the AmBank Group. âIf you want to propose, you should ask her father first... but (in this context), the father doesnât know about the matter, so how can you propose? âJokes aside, I was surprised also when I read the report... the report is just a speculation. âI have no comment because I donât know about that,â he told reporters when met at the RECODA Raya Rindok event organised by the Regional Corridor Development Authority (RECODA) here today. Abang Johari, however, said Sarawak is always ready to negotiate with any entity if there is one that wants to collaborate with the state government. Earlier, a report claimed that Sarawak, the largest shareholder of Affin Bank, was in talks with AmBank Group to merge the two banks. The report also claimed that Sarawak had contacted AmBank founder Tan Sri Azman Hashim and expressed interest in buying his stake in the group.

Title: Woman loses RM30,200 to online job scam
Summary: KUALA TERENGGANU : A 39-year-old woman lost RM30,200 to an online job scam after being lured through a WhatsApp group offering high-paying tasks. Kuala Terengganu police chief ACP Azli Mohd Noor said the victim was initially contacted on April 4 by an individual claiming she would receive a solar lamp as a gift. She was then invited to join a WhatsApp group offering commission-based tasks through an e-commerce platform. âAt the start, she completed a few tasks and received payment, which convinced her the offer was genuine,â he said when contacted today. However, Azli said the victim later failed to receive further payments and was told it was due to a late submission. Hoping to get her commission, she made six transactions totalling RM30,200 to the suspect. Realising she had been duped, she lodged a police report yesterday. The case is being investigated under Section 420 of the Penal Code for cheating.

Title: Malaysia, Thailand jointly funded cross-border bridge expected to be completed in 2028
Summary: BANGKOK : The construction of a jointly-funded second bridge and the upgrading of the existing bridge linking Rantau Panjang, Malaysia, and Sungai Kolok, Thailand, are expected to be completed by 2028. Minister of Works Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi stated that the project includes the construction of a new 117.3-metre bridge parallel to the existing one, along with comprehensive upgrades to the original structure. âWith an estimated cost of RM40.54 million, the project is jointly funded by both governments and is targeted for completion in 2028,â he said in a statement here today. Earlier, Nanta and Thailandâs Deputy Prime Minister cum Minister of Transport, Suriya Juangroongruangkit signed the Construction Agreement (CA) for the second bridge and the upgrading of the existing bridge. The exchange of the agreement was witnessed by Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim and Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, marking the formal commencement of this major cross-border infrastructure project between Malaysia and Thailand. Nanta remarked that the signing signifies another crucial step towards fostering sustainable regional development and inclusive growth. âIt aligns with Malaysiaâs Chairmanship of ASEAN under the theme âInclusivity and Sustainability,â which reflects the regionâs shared vision of collective progress - ensuring that development benefits all communities and no one is left behind,â he said. The minister highlighted that the collaboration demonstrates Malaysiaâs commitment to fostering regional development, strengthening bilateral ties, and ensuring inclusive prosperity for border communities. Once completed, the expanded infrastructure is expected to significantly enhance connectivity, trade, and people-to-people interactions, serving as a lasting symbol of the enduring friendship between Malaysia and Thailand. For the record, in 2012, under the Joint Development Strategy (JDS) for Border Areas endorsed by the Heads of State, Malaysiaâs Ministry of Works and Thailandâs Department of Highways under the Ministry of Transport agreed to expand the bridgeâs capacity to meet rising demands. Malaysia subsequently took the lead in designing the new structure, drawing inspiration from the traditional âPerahuâ (boat) motif, paying homage to Sungai Golokâs central role in linking Rantau Panjang in Kelantan and Su-ngai Kolok in Narathiwat.

Title: Anwar rakam penghargaan kepada kepimpinan Thailand yang majukan projek di sempadan
Summary: BANGKOK : Perdana Menteri Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim merakamkan ucapan terima kasih kepada kerajaan Thailand atas komitmennya untuk mengukuhkan hubungan dua hala dan memajukan projek di sempadan. Anwar yang memulakan lawatan kerja dua hari ke Thailand hari ini turut menyampaikan penghargaan kepada Perdana Menteri Thailand Paetongtarn Shinawatra terhadap layanan mesra dan mesyuarat dua hala yang telah diatur. âSaya juga ingin mengucapkan tahniah kepada kerajaan Thailand atas dedikasinya untuk mengukuhkan hubungan dua hala dan projek di sempadan. Projek-projek ini telah lama wujud, dan di bawah kepimpinan anda, ia dapat direalisasikan,â katanya sebagai membalas ucapan alu-aluan Paetongtarn sebaik tiba di Government House di sini. Anwar tiba di Government House di sini pada 1.50 petang (waktu tempatan) dengan disambut oleh Paetongtarn. Anwar kemudian mengetuai delegasi Malaysia dalam mesyuarat dua hala, dengan anggota delegasinya termasuk Menteri Pelaburan, Perdagangan dan Industri Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz; Menteri Kerja Raya Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi; Ketua Setiausaha Kementerian Luar Datuk Seri Amran Mohamed Zin; dan Duta Khas ASEAN ke Myanmar Tan Sri Othman Hashim. Sementara itu di pihak Thailand pula, Paetongtarn disertai oleh Timbalan Perdana Menteri dan Menteri Pengangkutan Suriya Juangroongruangkit, serta Menteri Luar Thailand Maris Sangiampongsa dalam mesyuarat itu. Usai mesyuarat dua hala itu, kedua-dua Perdana Menteri menyaksikan majlis menandatangani Memorandum Persefahaman (MoU) Perjanjian Pembinaan (CA) bagi Projek Jambatan Rantau Panjang-Sungai Golok oleh Nanta dan Suriya. Terdahulu dalam ucapan alu-aluannya, Paetongtarn turut menyampaikan ucapan terima kasih kepada Anwar atas lawatan itu, yang bertujuan untuk meningkatkan lagi kerjasama dua hala antara Thailand dan Malaysia. âKami akan terus bekerjasama dan membantu antara satu sama lain dalam pelbagai isu yang memberi kesan kepada dunia hari ini,â katanya. Ini lawatan kedua Anwar ke Thailand sejak memegang jawatan Perdana Menteri pada 2022, selepas lawatan sulungnya pada 2023, yang menyaksikan beliau menemui Perdana Menteri Thailand ketika itu Jeneral Prayut Chan-o-cha. Menurut Kementerian Luar Malaysia, pada 2024 Thailand adalah rakan perdagangan ketujuh terbesar Malaysia di peringkat global dan ketiga terbesar dalam kalangan negara anggota ASEAN dengan nilai dagangan USD25.03 bilion (RM114.56 bilion). Antara Januari dan Februari 2025, perdagangan dua hala kedua-dua negara mencecah USD3.96 bilion (RM17.65 bilion) berbanding USD3.67 bilion (RM16.80 bilion) bagi tempoh sama pada 2024.

Title: Dadah hampir RM15 juta ditemukan dalam kenderaan di LPT 1
Summary: KUANTAN : Polis menemukan dadah seberat 468.3 kilogram (kg) dianggar bernilai RM15 juta dalam sebuah kenderaan pacuan empat roda di KM211 Lebuhraya Pantai Timur (LPT) 1, arah Kuantan Selasa lepas. Ketua Polis Pahang Datuk Seri Yahaya Othman berkata kenderaan itu telah dijumpai pasukan peronda lebuh raya Jabatan Siasatan dan Penguatkuasaan Trafik Bukit Aman semasa melaksanakan Op Utama Zon Timur antara 10 pagi hingga 1 tengah hari. Beliau berkata ketika menjalankan operasi berkenaan, pasukan peronda telah menerima maklumat mengatakan sebuah kereta jenis Mitsubishi Triton telah dipandu secara melawan arus. âBertindak atas maklumat, pasukan peronda telah membuat pemantauan di LPT dan menemukan kenderaan terbabit di bahu jalan dalam keadaan pintu berkunci tanpa pemandu dan penumpang,â katanya pada sidang media di sini hari ini. Yahaya berkata pemeriksaan lanjut di bahagian belakang dan dalam kenderaan itu menemukan 22 plastik berwarna hitam mengandungi 440 bungkusan bertulisan âchinese pin weiâ berisi ketulan kristal jernih dipercayai dadah jenis syabu. âUsaha mengesan pemilik kenderaan masih dijalankan dan mana-mana pemandu yang mempunyai rakaman kamera papan pemuka ketika kejadian diminta tampil membantu siasatan,â katanya sambil menambah kes disiasat mengikut Seksyen 39B Akta Dadah Berbahaya 1952.

Title: Tengku Zafrul bertemu wakil perdagangan AS, pegawai di Washington pada 24 April
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR : Menteri Pelaburan, Perdagangan dan Industri Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz dijadualkan bertemu Wakil Perdagangan Amerika Syarikat (USTR) Jamieson Greer dan pegawai lain yang berkaitan di Washington pada 24 April, untuk membincangkan tarif balas yang telah dikenakan ke atas Malaysia. âKami akan bertemu USTR dan pegawai kerajaan lain daripada pentadbiran Presiden Amerika Syarikat (AS) Donald Trump dalam lawatan saya selama dua hari,â katanya. Delegasi Malaysia juga akan mengambil peluang untuk bertemu beberapa dewan perniagaan, syarikat dan kumpulan berkepentingan bagi menerangkan pendirian dan situasi negara serta maklum balas yang diterima daripada Kabinet, kata Tengku Zafrul dalam taklimat media baru-baru ini. âKami perlu ke sana untuk menjelaskan bagaimana Malaysia, sebuah negara neutral memainkan peranan penting dalam sektor semikonduktor serta elektrik dan elektronik. Matlamat kami untuk menunjukkan bahawa Malaysia boleh menyokong industri di AS berbanding memberi ancaman kepada mereka,â katanya. Beliau akan diiringi Timbalan Ketua Setiausaha (Perdagangan) Kementerian Pelaburan, Perdagangan dan Industri (MITI) Mastura Ahmad Mustafa serta pegawai lain dari kementerian. Wakil MITI di Kedutaan Malaysia di Washington akan menyertai delegasi itu. Tengku Zafrul menjelaskan perjalanan itu bukan untuk rundingan tetapi perbincangan. âKami tidak pergi ke sana untuk membincangkan butiran rundingan. Rundingan mengambil masa, bukan? Oleh itu, ia lebih kepada berbincang mengenai bagaimana Malaysia boleh memainkan peranan penting dalam rantaian bekalan antara Asia dan AS,â katanya. Walaupun lawatan ini untuk Malaysia, Tengku Zafrul berkata beliau juga akan mengambil peluang untuk menyatakan pendirian ASEAN mengenai isu tarif tersebut terutamanya hasil daripada mesyuarat khas Menteri-Menteri Ekonomi ASEAN. âBerdasarkan Malaysia sebagai pengerusi ASEAN, saya juga akan menjelaskan pendirian ASEAN iaitu kami mempercayai sistem perdagangan global berasaskan peraturan, merupakan prinsip multilateralisme  dalam perdagangan,â katanya. ASEAN dan Malaysia telah menyatakan dengan jelas bahawa mereka tidak akan mengambil sebarang tindakan balas. âKami juga ingin menerangkan kepada AS bahawa ramai di antara kami, termasuk ASEAN sendiri, tidak berasakan (dakwaan) bahawa kami telah mengenakan tarif yang begitu tinggi ke atas produk AS. Kami ingin memperbetul beberapa pandangan yang salah,â katanya. Dalam kenyataan bersama yang dikeluarkan selepas mesyuarat khas itu pada 10 April, para menteri berkata ASEAN akan terlibat dalam dialog yang jujur dan konstruktif dengan AS untuk menangani kebimbangan berkaitan perdagangan. Para menteri berkata ASEAN kekal komited untuk melindungi kepentingan ekonomi blok ini serta mengekalkan hubungan perdagangan yang kukuh dan saling memberi manfaat dengan AS. Negara anggota Indo-China ASEAN merupakan yang paling teruk terkesan ekoran tarif ini, dengan Kemboja menghadapi gabungan tarif asas dan tarif balas sebanyak 49 peratus, diikuti Laos (48 peratus), Vietnam (46 peratus) dan Myanmar (44 peratus). Thailand dikenakan tarif 36 peratus, Indonesia 32 peratus, Brunei dan Malaysia, masing-masing 24 peratus, Filipina 17 peratus manakala Singapura dengan tarif asas 10 peratus. Tarif balas tersebut kini dalam tempoh penangguhan selama 90 hari, kecuali bagi China.

Title: DBKL diberi empat bulan laksana pemutihan peniaga tanpa lesen - Dr Zaliha
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR : Dewan Bandaraya Kuala Lumpur (DBKL) diberi tempoh empat bulan untuk melaksanakan pemutihan menyeluruh peniaga tidak berlesen atau dikenali sebagai peniaga âramboâ di ibu kota. Menteri di Jabatan Perdana Menteri (Wilayah Persekutuan) Datuk Seri Dr Zaliha Mustafa berkata ia merupakan antara pendekatan untuk melestarikan peniaga, khususnya peniaga kecil-kecilan dan penjaja untuk mendapatkan lesen. âKita (DBKL) akan benarkan hingga Ogos ini untuk semua peniaga yang tiada lesen tampil dan berurusan dengan kita untuk mendaftar serta mendapatkan lesen berniaga di sekitar Kuala Lumpur. Kita ada pelbagai jenis lesen sebenarnya, bergantung kepada keperluan masing-masing, insya-Allah kita akan membantu dari sudut itu. âKena faham, tidak semua kita boleh berikan lesen, ada pertimbangannya. DBKL perlu melihat kepada keseluruhan ekosistem penjaja dan cadangkan penyelesaian yang lebih strategik, bukan hanya berasaskan status quo sahaja,â katanya selepas program Semarak Aidilfitri di Dataran DBKL di sini hari ini. Dr Zaliha berkata pada masa ini pihaknya tidak mempunyai jumlah peniaga tidak berlesen, namun berharap langkah pemutihan itu dapat memberikan data dan pemetaan dalam isu itu. Beliau berkata walaupun seseorang penjaja itu mendapat lesen, mereka perlu mematuhi peraturan dan tidak bermakna mereka bebas berniaga di mana-mana kawasan sehingga membahayakan keselamatan orang lain. âContohnya, di kawasan terbuka dan ramai orang, kita tidak boleh benarkan menjual bahan-bahan yang mungkin mudah meletup seperti belon yang ada hidrogen. Ia sangat bahaya,â katanya. Mengulas mengenai trend trak makanan dan gerai di kaki lima, beliau berkata pihaknya akan memperhalusi prosedur seperti memastikan ada ruang pejalan kaki, mewartakan sesuatu kawasan untuk tujuan berkenaan atau dibenarkan beroperasi pada waktu-waktu tertentu sahaja. Beliau turut meminta peniaga dan orang ramai untuk menjaga adab dan memberikan kerjasama kepada pihak berkuasa ketika menjalankan tugas mereka. Terdahulu, Dr Zaliha dan Datuk Bandar Kuala Lumpur Datuk Seri Dr Maimunah Mohd Sharif menyampaikan sumbangan zakat berupa wang tunai RM200 kepada 500 orang asnaf termasuk anak-anak yatim, warga emas, ibu tunggal, orang kurang upaya dan mereka yang kurang kemampuan, manakala 500 lagi dijangka menerima bantuan itu secara berperingkat. Bantuan sejumlah RM200,000 itu adalah sumbangan wang zakat daripada Majlis Agama Islam Wilayah Persekutuan.

Title: Anwar praises Thai leadership in advancing border projects
Summary: BANGKOK : Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim has expressed his gratitude to the Thai government for its commitment to strengthening bilateral relations and advancing border projects. Anwar, who began his two-day working visit to Thailand on Thursday, also thanked Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra for accommodating the working visit and bilateral meeting held today on short notice. âI also wish to congratulate the Thai government on its dedication to strengthening bilateral relations and border projects. âThese projects have been longstanding, and under your leadership, they have been realised,â he said in response to Paetongtarnâs welcoming address upon his arrival at Government House for the bilateral meeting. The Malaysian delegation includes Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry, Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Abdul Aziz; Works Minister Datuk Seri Alexander Nanta Linggi; Foreign Ministry Secretary-General Datuk Seri Amran Mohamed Zin; and ASEANâs Special Envoy to Myanmar, Tan Sri Othman Hashim. The Thai delegation, led by Paetongtarn, comprised Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Transport Suriya Juangroongruangkit and Foreign Minister Maris Sangiampongsa. After the meeting, both Prime Ministers witnessed the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on the Construction Agreement (CA) for the Rantau Panjang-Sungai Golok Bridge Project. The MoU was inked by Nanta and Suriya, with the CA documents exchanged shortly thereafter. In her welcoming remarks, Paetongtarn also expressed her gratitude to Anwar for the visit, which aims to further enhance bilateral cooperation between Thailand and Malaysia. âWe will continue to collaborate and assist each other on various issues affecting the world today, she said. This is Anwarâs second trip to Thailand since assuming office in 2022, after the first in 2023, during which he met then-Prime Minister General Prayut Chan-o-cha. According to the Malaysian Foreign Ministry, in 2024, Thailand was Malaysiaâs seventh-largest trading partner globally and third-largest within ASEAN, with total trade amounting to USD25.03 billion (RM114.56 billion). Between January and February this year, bilateral trade stood at USD3.96 billion (RM17.65 billion), up from USD3.67 billion (RM16.80 billion) during the same period in 2024.

Title: Bukit Aman op finds meth worth RM15 million in abandoned 4WD on East Coast Highway
Summary: KUANTAN : Police found 468.3 kilogrammes (kg) of crystal meth worth RM15 million in a four-wheel drive vehicle (4WD) abandoned at Kilometre 211 (KM211) of the East Coast Highway 1 (LPT1), parked in the direction headed towards Kuantan on Tuesday. Pahang police chief Datuk Seri Yahaya Othman said the vehicle was found by the Bukit Aman Traffic Investigation and Enforcement Department (JSPT) during Op Utama Zon Timur conducted between 10 am and 1 pm. He said that during the operation, the highway patrol received information that a white Mitsubishi Triton vehicle was going against the flow of traffic. âActing on the information, the highway patrol scoured the LPT and discovered the vehicle (abandoned) on a road shoulder with its doors locked, without a driver or passengers,â he said at the Pahang contingent police headquarters here today. Yahaya said that an inspection of the rear and inside of the vehicle led to the discovery of 22 black plastic bags containing 440 packages, labelled âChinese Pin Wei,â which were filled with clear crystal chunks suspected to be methamphetamine. âEfforts to track down the vehicleâs owner are still underway and we urge drivers who have dashboard camera recordings of the incident to come forward to assist in the investigation,â he also said, adding that the case is being investigated under Section 39B of the Dangerous Drugs Act 1952.

Title: Tengku Zafrul to meet US trade rep, officials in Washington on April 24 to discuss tariffs
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR : Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry (MITI), Tengku Datuk Seri Zafrul Aziz is set to meet United States Trade Representative (USTR), Jamieson Greer and other relevant officials in Washington on April 24, to discuss the reciprocal tariff imposed on Malaysia. âWe will be meeting the USTR as well as other government officials from US President Donald Trumpâs administration during my two-day visit,â he said. The Malaysian delegation will also take the opportunity to meet some chambers, companies and interest groups to explain the countryâs stand and situation as well as the feedback received from the Cabinet, Tengku Zafrul said in a recent press briefing. âWe need to go there to explain how Malaysia, as a neutral country, plays an important role in the semiconductor and electrical and electronics sectors. Our goal is to show that Malaysia can support industries in the US rather than posing a threat to them,â he emphasised. The minister will be accompanied by the MITI deputy secretary-general (trade) Mastura Ahmad Mustafa, as well as other officials from the ministry. MITIâs representatives at Malaysiaâs Embassy in Washington will join the delegation. The Minister clarified that the trip is not for negotiation but discussion. âWe are not going there to discuss the details of negotiation. Negotiation takes time, right? So, it is more to talk about how Malaysia can play an important role in the supply chain between Asia and the US,â Tengku Zafrul said. Although this visit is purely for Malaysia, Tengku Zafrul said he will also take the opportunity to reiterate ASEANâs stand on the tariff issue, especially the outcome of the special ASEAN Economic Ministersâ meeting. âAs Malaysia is ASEAN chair, I will also explain ASEANâs position as well, which is, we believe in the rule-based global trading system, which is the principles of multilateralism when it comes to trade,â he said. ASEAN and Malaysia have clearly stated that they will not take any retaliatory measures. âWe also all want to explain to the US that many of us, ASEAN itself, do not believe that we have imposed such high tariffs on US products. We want to correct some of the wrong views,â Tengku Zafrul said. In a joint statement issued after the special meeting on April 10,  ASEAN said it will engage in a frank and constructive dialogue with the US to address trade-related concerns. The ministers said the grouping remains committed to safeguarding ASEANâs economic interests as well as maintaining strong and mutually beneficial trade relations with the US. ASEANâs Indochina member states were the hardest hit by the tariffs, with Cambodia facing combined baseline and retaliatory duties totalling 49 per cent, followed by Laos (48 per cent), Vietnam (46 per cent), and Myanmar (44 per cent). Thailand was subjected to tariffs of 36 per cent, Indonesia 32 per cent, Brunei and Malaysia both 24 per cent, the Philippines 17 per cent, while Singapore faced a baseline tariff of 10 per cent. The reciprocal tariffs are currently on a 90-day pause, except for China.

Title: DBKL given four months to regularise unlicensed traders - Dr Zaliha
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR : The Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL) has been given four months to conduct a regularisation exercise for unlicensed traders, commonly known as âRamboâ vendors, in the federal capital. Minister in the Prime Ministerâs Department (Federal Territories) Datuk Seri Dr Zaliha Mustafa said the initiative is one of the approaches to support sustainability among traders, particularly small-scale traders and hawkers, in obtaining business licences. âWe will allow until August for all unlicensed traders to come forward and register with us (DBKL) to apply for business licences in Kuala Lumpur. We offer various types of licences based on individual needs, and, insya-Allah, we are committed to assisting in this process. âHowever, it must be understood that not everyone can be granted a licence.  There are considerations. DBKL needs to examine the entire hawker ecosystem and propose more strategic solutions, rather than simply maintaining the status quo,â she said after attending the Semarak Aidilfitri event at Dataran DBKL here today. Dr Zaliha said the ministry currently does not have an exact number of unlicensed traders but hopes that the regularisation exercise will help provide data and mapping on the issue. She added that even if a hawker obtains a licence, they must still adhere to the regulations, and it does not mean they can operate anywhere in a manner that jeopardises public safety. âFor example, in open and crowded areas, we cannot allow the sale of potentially explosive items like hydrogen-filled balloons. They are very dangerous if not properly controlled,â she said. Commenting on the trend of food trucks and sidewalk stalls, she said that the ministry would improve procedures such as ensuring pedestrian space, gazetting certain areas, or permitting operations only during specific hours. Meanwhile, she urged traders and the public to remain courteous and cooperative with authorities during enforcement activities. Earlier, Dr Zaliha and Kuala Lumpur Mayor Datuk Seri Dr Maimunah Mohd Sharif presented zakat donations in the form of RM200 cash to 500 asnaf recipients, including orphans, senior citizens, single mothers, persons with disabilities, and the underprivileged, with another 500 expected to receive the aid in stages.

Title: State govts urged to ban vape sales to curb synthetic drug abuse
Summary: ALOR SETAR : State governments can take action by banning the sale of electronic cigarettes or vape, which are now increasingly linked to the abuse of new synthetic drugs, Deputy Inspector-General of Police Datuk Seri Ayob Khan Mydin Pitchay said. He said this was following the detection of school students as young as 13 years old using vape devices containing substances mixed with drugs, which could pose a new threat to the country if not curbed. Ayob Khan said some states had already taken the initiative to ban vape sales, bringing a positive impact, and encouraged other state governments to follow suit while waiting for the federal government to draft related laws. âSome states have made that decision, meaning state governments can also impose bans, because the sale licence is under the jurisdiction of local authorities. While waiting for the federal government to enact new laws, state governments can take action, and even if not entirely comprehensive, the impact is significant. âIf you ask me personally, vape is more dangerous than cigarettes. We must make efforts toward that direction because whatâs worrying is that 65 per cent of vape contents contain banned substances like methamphetamine and ecstasy, both classified as poisons,â he told reporters here today. Johor has maintained a ban and has not issued any vape or electronic cigarette sales licences since Jan 1, 2016, enforcing laws prohibiting vaping and taking action against traders involved in selling such devices. Ayob Khan said all parties must work together to tackle the issue, as vape is easily manipulated by adding dangerous new drugs, which could destroy the future of the younger generation. âA recent study in Kelantan found that the youngest users of vape are aged between 13 to 17 years. The study also found that 31 per cent of users are active, seven per cent vape regularly, and 76 per cent know individuals who use vape,â he said. He said the drug fentanyl, known as the âzombie drugâ, has also been detected in vape liquids, with effects 100 times stronger and more dangerous than morphine and 20 to 40 times stronger than heroin. Meanwhile, Ayob Khan said a drug laboratory raided by the Bukit Aman Narcotics Crime Investigation Department (JSJN) in an operation in Kedah yesterday also uncovered activities involving the processing of vape liquids and mushrooms containing drugs. In the operation, police seized 110 vape cartridges and 67 bottles of vape liquid produced in the laboratory, intended for distribution in Kedah, Penang and the Klang Valley. âThe operation covered the Kuala Muda, Pendang, Kota Setar and Pokok Sena zones, with 61 individuals arrested and various types of drugs estimated to be worth RM6 million seized for further action,â he said. Ayob Khan also said that police would apply for an allocation of RM80 million from the Home Ministry to acquire new equipment to enhance the forceâs capability in detecting new drugs in the country.

Title: Negeri boleh haramkan penjualan vape, banteras penyalahgunaan dadah
Summary: ALOR SETAR : Kerajaan negeri boleh mengambil tindakan mengharamkan penjualan rokok elektronik atau vape yang kini menjurus kepada penyalahgunaan dadah sintetik baharu. Timbalan Ketua Polis Negara Datuk Seri Ayob Khan Mydin Pitchay berkata perkara itu semakin membimbangkan apabila terdapat pelajar sekolah seawal usia 13 tahun dikesan menggunakan vape mengandungi bahan dicampur dadah yang jika tidak dikekang boleh menjadi ancaman baharu di negara ini. Beliau berkata terdapat negeri telah mengambil inisiatif mengharamkan penjualan vape yang membawa impak positif dan kerajaan negeri lain disaran mengikut jejak sama sementara menunggu kerajaan Persekutuan menggubal undang-undang berkaitan. âAda sesetengah negeri ambil keputusan itu, maknanya kerajaan negeri pun boleh keluarkan larangan, sebab lesen penjualan di bawah PBT (pihak berkuasa tempatan), sementara nak tunggu kerajaan Pusat nak gubal undang-undang baharu kerajaan negeri boleh ambil tindakan walaupun tak keseluruhan tapi impaknya memang ada. âBila tanya saya secara peribadi, vape lagi bahaya daripada rokok, kita perlu ada usaha menjurus ke arah itu kerana apa membimbangkan kita 65 peratus daripada kandungan vape ini ada bahan terlarang seperti methamphetamine dan ekstasi, ini semua bahan disenaraikan sebagai racun,â katanya kepada pemberita di sini, hari ini. Johor kekal melarang dan tidak mengeluarkan sebarang kebenaran lesen penjualan vape atau rokok elektronik di negeri itu sejak 1 Januari 2016 serta menguatkuasakan undang-undang melarang menghisap vape termasuk mengambil tindakan terhadap peniaga yang didapati melakukan urusan jual beli peranti berkenaan. Ayob Khan menambah semua pihak perlu berusaha menangani isu itu memandangkan vape dilihat mudah dimanipulasi dengan dimasukkan dadah-dadah baharu yang berbahaya sehingga merosakkan masa depan golongan remaja. âKajian terbaharu di Kelantan, umur paling muda terlibat vape adalah 13 hingga 17 tahun, dalam kajian itu juga didapati 31 peratus penggunanya aktif, tujuh peratus menggunakan vape secara kerap dan 76 peratus lagi kenal dengan individu yang menggunakan vape,â katanya. Menurutnya lagi, dadah jenis fentanyl yang dikenali âdadah zombieâ turut dikesan digunakan sebagai bahan dalam cecair vape yang kesannya 100 kali ganda berbahaya dan kuat berbanding morfin serta 20 hingga 40 kali lebih kuat daripada heroin. Dalam pada itu, makmal dadah yang diserbu Jabatan Siasatan Jenayah Narkotik (JSJN) Bukit Aman dalam Op Kenari di negeri ini semalam turut membongkar kegiatan memproses cecair vape serta mushroom yang mengandungi dadah. Katanya dalam operasi itu, pihaknya merampas 110 katrij dan 67 botol cecair vape yang dihasilkan di makmal tersebut untuk dipasarkan di negeri ini, Pulau Pinang dan Lembah Klang. âOperasi itu melibatkan Zon Kuala Muda, Pendang, Kota Setar dan Pokok Sena di mana seramai 61 orang berjaya ditahan dan pelbagai jenis dadah dianggarkan bernilai RM6 juta dirampas untuk tindakan lanjut,â katanya. Sementara itu, beliau berkata pihaknya akan memohon peruntukan RM80 juta daripada Kementerian Dalam Negeri untuk peralatan baharu dalam usaha meningkatkan keupayaan polis mengesan dadah baharu di negara ini.

Title: Hollywoodâs fading charm in China -- and why U.S. tariffs are making it worse
Summary: BEIJING : Once the king of Chinaâs silver screen, Hollywood now finds itself sidelined, as local blockbusters surge and Washingtonâs tariffs against the rest of the world add fuel to shifting audience sentiment. According to data released this week, Chinese animated feature âNe Zha 2â has scored a thunderous success, raking in 15.2 billion yuan (about 2.11 billion U.S. dollars) at Chinaâs box office in just 12 weeks. In stark contrast, the top-performing American film so far this year, âA Minecraft Movieâ from Warner Bros., has just crossed 150 million yuan and failed to break into Chinaâs top 10 films of 2025. That continues a sobering trend: 2024 marked the second consecutive year in which no Hollywood title cracked the one-billion-yuan mark, a symbolic threshold once routinely surpassed. The sharp contrast highlights the deepening decline of Hollywoodâs influence in the worldâs second-largest movie market. Analysts say U.S. tariffs and trade restrictions are only accelerating the slide. CREATIVE DECLINE Industry data tells the story. American moviesâ share of Chinaâs annual box office revenue has plunged from 36 percent in 2018 and 30 percent in 2019 to just 14 percent in 2024, according to figures from box office tracker Maoyan, obtained by Xinhua. That fading influence extends beyond box office numbers. âAmerican blockbusters arenât drawing much of a crowd anymore,â wrote one Weibo user nicknamed âSurfaceMe,â blaming a mix of lackluster quality and declining favorability amid tariff and trade tensions. âThe appeal, emotional resonance, and cultural impact of Hollywood films are fading among Chinese audiences,â said Rao Shuguang, president of the China Film Critics Association. âCreatively, Hollywood has grown conservative, leaning too heavily on Marvel and other franchise fare. The visual spectacle remains, but viewers are experiencing aesthetic fatigue. And on a deeper level, American stories often feel disconnected from Chinese life, making it harder to generate empathy or emotional response.â According to a China Film News report, original Hollywood productions accounted for just 18.6 percent of all U.S. studio releases in 2024, a dramatic decline from 40.9 percent in 2000. In contrast, sequels, reboots, adaptations and spinoffs now account for 81.4 percent. This cost-efficient but creatively cautious model has dampened Chinese viewersâ expectations for high-quality cinematic content, it says. DWINDLING FAVORABILITY But Hollywoodâs creative slump is only part of the picture. Industry insiders point to another force hastening its fall in China: the long shadow of Washingtonâs aggressive tariff policy and its downstream effects on public sentiment. Film is part of the broader U.S. services sector, where the United States has traditionally maintained a significant trade surplus with China. According to the U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. service exports to China grew more than eightfold between 2001 and 2023, with the annual surplus peaking at nearly 40 billion dollars. Film and other IP-driven content have long been a key part of that advantage. âU.S. politicians fixated on manufacturing trade deficits are overlooking the billions America has earned through services,â said Ming Jinwei, a Beijing-based commentator and widely followed blogger. He warned that weaponizing tariffs could backfire by undermining Americaâs winning sectors. âIrrational U.S. tariffs could trigger a chain reaction, as IP-driven cultural industries are âcross-media, integrated and long-chained,ââ said Chen Xuguang, director of the Institute of Film, Television and Theatre at Peking University. Washingtonâs tariff policies risk triggering a ripple effect, with audiences drifting away from Hollywood films and potentially other U.S. cultural exports tied to major IP, he said. REPERCUSSIONS Washingtonâs trade restrictions and tariff escalations against China are already being felt in the reception of American cultural exports here. Franchises like Transformers, Fast & Furious and even Marvel, once guaranteed box office juggernauts, are now performing inconsistently -- or outright poorly -- in China. âItâs been rare for an American film to cross the 100 million yuan mark in China in recent years -- unless itâs something truly special,â said Dong Wenxin, a film critic and manager of a cinema in Jinan, Shandong Province. âTheyâre getting beaten not just by Japanese anime but also by European arthouse and regional Asian surprises.â Tastes are shifting. Japanese animation continues to draw steady crowds, while European and Southeast Asian films are gaining ground. This yearâs surprise hits, Italyâs âThereâs Still Tomorrowâ and Britainâs âNational Theatre Live: Prima Facie,â have exceeded expectations. Thailandâs âHow to Make Millions Before Grandma Diesâ became a breakout sleeper last year. Looking ahead, Dong said Chinaâs film market is likely to forge even closer ties beyond the United States to meet the increasingly diverse audience needs. And Beijing is already moving in that direction. A recent film agreement with Spain calls for deepening collaboration on co-productions, film festivals and mutual screenings, signaling that China is broadening its cultural partnerships. The irony is stark: Washingtonâs trade restrictions and tariff moves, designed to protect American industries, may end up crippling one of the countryâs most impactful exports -- its cultural influence, analysts say. âU.S. tariffs donât just tax goods -- they tax appeal,â said Ming. âAnd in todayâs global entertainment economy, once that appeal wanes, even the strongest cultural influence may have to struggle to endure.â

Title: King Charles III praises humanitarian workers in Easter message
Summary: LONDON: King Charles III on Thursday paid tribute to humanitarian workers who ârisk their own livesâ to protect others in war-torn countries, in a message broadcast to mark Easter. âOne of the puzzles of our humanity is how we are capable of both great cruelty and great kindness,â said the British monarch, who is also head of the Anglican Church, in a message published by Buckingham Palace. âThis paradox of human life runs through the Easter story and in the scenes that daily come before our eyes -- at one moment, terrible images of human suffering and, in another, heroic acts in war-torn countries where humanitarians of every kind risk their own lives to protect the lives of others,â he added. The king, who is still receiving weekly treatment for an unspecified cancer diagnosed in early 2024, and Queen Camilla are due to attend Maundy Thursday services at Durham Cathedral in north-east England, before attending a traditional Easter Mass in Windsor on Sunday. The monarch is duty-bound to remain politically neutral, and did not mention any particular conflicts. However, his message comes at a time when the number of humanitarian workers killed reached a record high of 280 in 2024, according to the UN, as conflict rages in Gaza, Sudan and Ukraine. The king also stressed the similar duty of care for strangers demanded by Judaism, Islam, âin other religious traditions and in the hearts of all those who seek the good of othersâ. âThere are three virtues that the world still needs - faith, hope and love. And the greatest of these is love,â he added. âIt is with these timeless truths in my mind, and my heart, that I wish you all a blessed and peaceful Easter.â

Title: Pembukaan semula Menara KL akan dilakukan secepat mungkin - Fahmi
Summary: KUALA LUMPUR : Menara Kuala Lumpur (Menara KL) yang ditutup sementara bermula hari ini bagi memberi laluan kepada kerja-kerja penyelenggaraan serta menyelesaikan isu berkaitan keselamatan, akan dibuka semula secepat mungkin. Menteri Komunikasi Datuk Fahmi Fadzil berkata menara komunikasi itu akan segera dibuka kepada pengunjung selepas dua aspek utama berkenaan diselesaikan oleh pemegang konsesi baharu LSH Service Master Sdn Bhd (LSHSM). âSyarikat konsesi baharu memerlukan sedikit masa untuk melaksanakan kerja-kerja berkaitan secara teliti bagi menjamin keselamatan pengunjung,â katanya yang juga jurucakap Kerajaan MADANI. Beliau berkata demikian pada sidang media mingguan di Angkasapuri di sini hari ini, yang turut dihadiri Timbalan Menteri Komunikasi Teo Nie Ching dan Ketua Setiausaha Kementerian Komunikasi Datuk Mohamad Fauzi Md Isa. Fahmi berkata pasukan Kementerian Komunikasi sudah melakukan lawatan di bangunan Menara KL baru-baru ini dan mendapati banyak perkara, antaranya perkakas di dapur restoran berputar di situ, tidak berada dalam keadaan yang ânyamanâ untuk pengunjung. âSelain itu terdapat juga aspek-aspek berkaitan keselamatan kepada pengunjung yang kita lihat agak merisaukan dan perlu tindakan segera, antaranya pagar penghadang (railing) di dek menara yang telah diturunkan,â katanya. Mengulas status 205 petugas syarikat konsesi lama, Menara Kuala Lumpur Sdn Bhd (MKLSB), Fahmi memaklumkan bahawa 193 daripada mereka telah bersetuju menerima tawaran bekerja semula dengan syarikat baharu LSHSM. âBerpandukan kepada notis penamatan perkhidmatan (petugas MKLSB) pada 18 Dis lepas, semua 205 pekerja itu tamat perkhidmatan pada 31 Mac lepas, bersamaan hari raya pertama. Kementerian Komunikasi telah minta syarikat baharu (LSHSM) untuk ambil semua pekerja ini kerana mereka sudah berbelas tahun bekerja di Menara KL, amat berpengalaman. âAntara syarat utama dalam tawaran kepada 205 kakitangan itu ialah LSHSM perlu menawarkan tangga gaji yang no less favourable daripada apa yang mereka perolehi dengan syarikat terdahulu,â katanya.
